ManSection.Description: A polytope is orientable if its flag graph is bipartite. Currently only implemented for regular polytopes.
For a subset I of {0, ..., n-1}, a polytope if I-orientable if every closed path in its flag graph contains an even number of edges with colors in I. Currently only implemented for regular polytopes.
A polytope is vertex-bipartite if its 1-skeleton is bipartite. This is equivalent to being I-orientable for I = {0}.
A polytope is facet-bipartite if the 1-skeleton of its dual is bipartite. This is equivalent to being I-orientable for I = {n-1}.
